page.title: 05Education- GUILDTOWN P. SCH.
page.content: Guildtown Primary School is the only school in our Project area. It is a typical Scottish Rural School catering for all children in the area from age 5 to 12. Like most of the others it was built in 1875 following the Education Act of 1872. It has been extensively added to and has been continually modernised since then. Today there are 65 pupils in three classrooms_ Primary 1&2 in one; P3,4&5 next and P6&7 in the third room. There is a reasonably large hall which doubles as a Dining_room and Gym. Adjoining the building there is a very large playing field in which there are two football pitches, two sets of swings, a roundabout and a large climbing frame. Most of the pupils travel to school by private bus provided by the Education Authority.
